Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/21-: Clue offers insight into a current quest or mystery
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/25-: Clue to a lifeform's nature or vulnerabilities
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/33-: Foe inadvertently reveals themselves or tips their hand
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/37-: Friendly interaction with a benign lifeform
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/53-: Helpful or encouraging message from an acquaintance
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/57-: Impressive vista offers comfort or inspiration
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/61-: Interesting site offers opportunities for exploration
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/69-: Navigational or environmental hazard is left behind
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/73-: Opening to escape or avoid foes
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/77-: Plea for help from a potential benefactor
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/81-: Probe or beacon with useful data
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/85-: Refuge offers a place to hide, plan, or recover
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/93-: Sensors reveal helpful or interesting environmental data
Starforged/Oracles/Space/Opportunity/97-: Vehicle or equipment performs beyond expectations
Starforged/Oracles/Starships/Mission-des: Use the Starship Mission table when prompted by another oracle, or to flesh out the nature of a ship or fleet which has a flexible or uncertain role. You can also roll to generate the focus of a spaceborne quest.
Starforged/Oracles/Starships/Name-descri: Give a starship a name when it has an important role in your story. Scan this table and select a name which fits what you know of the ship’s appearance and role. Or generate a random result and let any contradictions contribute to the ship’s history or nature.
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults-description: When you first come upon a vault, use the tables on the previous two pages to help envision its form and nature. For a more abstract prompt, just use the Descriptor oracle. In either case—if that’s enough detail for the role of the vault in your story—stop there.
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Outer_First_Lo: Phasing in and out of reality
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Interior/First: Use this table to reveal what you see or encounter when first entering the site. These aspects, combined with the exterior features, will help you envision the nature and condition of the vault and provide context for the rest of your exploration.
Reactive lighting responds to your presence
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Interior/Featu: Elevated path over chasm or shaft
Inscrutable object lies dark and silent
Signs of an attack or battle
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Interior/Peril: Use this table to help envision a complication within a vault, such as when you <u>Explore a Waypoint</u> and are prompted to envision a peril.
Dire warning left by other explorers
Hazardous path designed for traversal by other beings
Tempting location or object holds hidden dangers
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Interior/Oppor: Use this table to help envision a favorable circumstance within a vault, such as when you <u>Explore a Waypoint</u> and are prompted to envision an opportunity.
Clue points the way to your destination or target
Clue to a lifeform's nature or vulnerabilities
Helpful gear left by another explorer
Insight into the nature or history of this site
Opening to get the drop on a foe
Opening to outmaneuver or escape a threat or foe
Secure area offers a moment of peace
Shortcut or less perilous path speeds your way
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Sanctum/Purpos: Because precursor vaults are alien and enigmatic, understanding their ultimate purpose requires investigation and exploration. Use this table to reveal the vault’s original function or role at an appropriate point in your survey. This can come as an outcome of completing an expedition, or when your story naturally leads you to a revelation of the site’s nature.
Capture or control of other beings
Preservation of maps or navigational data
Safekeeping of cultural records or memories
Surveying or monitoring of a location
Worship of a god or being
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Sanctum/Featur: Central chamber of immense proportions or grandeur
Incongruent space contradicts the nature of this site
Inscrutable object emits sound and energy
Pockets or layers of altered atmosphere
Pods or chambers with preserved corpses
Surfaces covered in slime or fungus
Visions of this place in another time
Visions or reflections of another reality
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Sanctum/Peril/: Camouflaged or transforming foe reveals itself
Horrifying fate for a previous intruder
Led astray or lured into danger by a manifestation or illusion
Lost the way or separated from others
Manifestations prey upon your weaknesses or worries
Other intruders have been corrupted or mutated by this place
Scene of hideous violence or death
Spawning or swarming foes surround you
Temptations to linger or remain in this site
You are marked by physical corruption or mutation
Starforged/Oracles/Vaults/Sanctum/Opport: Access to a secret or protected area
Clue points the way to your destination or target
Control or terminal adjusts to accept your input
Deeper insight into the history or nature of this site
Device or artifact reveals its purpose
Environment adjusts to better suit you
Foes stand down or give way
Key offers control of a function or aspect of this site
Shortcut or less perilous path speeds your way
momentum-cancel: Action die cancelled for matching negative momentum (see p. 32).
action-score-limit-alert: The action score is never greater than 10—anything over that is ignored (see p. 26).
roll-match-description: An extreme result or twist has occurred.
legacy-assets-description:
As part of releasing 1.0, existing character sheets need to copy the data from their legacy assets into the section below and delete the old assets. This has the updated the assets, the legacy section only has the old assets. Once done you can hide the old assets by clicking the toggle legacy assets button and then click hide this box.

Alternatively if you want to keep the legacy assets section you can simply click hide this box.
changelog-summary: Part 1 of the full release has now been done, which includes the updated oracles and assets. Note for existing character sheets please refer to the assets page as there is additional work that needs to be done, as it required a change for how assets were handled and the fact some assets were removed/changed in the full release. The move updates will be released next.
